newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Oil majors bid for Bangladesh oil/gas exploration.
newsitem.headline: Oil majors bid for Bangladesh oil/gas exploration.

text.p: Twenty major oil companies bid on Tuesday for 12 oil and gas exploration blocks in Bangladesh, Energy Ministry officials said.
They said Bangladesh called for international bids for 15 blocks across the country, having earlier offered eight blocks to foreign firms.

The officials said Cairn Energy Plc jointly with Shell Hydrocarbons Holdings BV was the top bidder, seeking exploration rights in six blocks. There was no bidding for blocks 1,2 and 23 in Bangladesh's northwestern region, they said.
They said production sharing contracts with successful bidders would be completed by December this year.
The officials said the other bidders included Chevron Corp, Enron Oil and Gas, Texaco Corp, Mobil Eastern E & D Inc Unocal and Tullow Oil Plc.

"We are happy with the response in the bidding. It's a demonstration of the great potential that Bangladesh has in the energy sector, and the interest the foreign companies are showing," said one energy ministry official.
